author: Special Correspondent
text:
Mahamagam festival provides an opportunity for publishers writers to contribute their mite for the benefit of the devotees.

A number of publications have brought out booklets and hand-bills, projecting the significance of the temple tank (mahamagam tank) and the temples associated with the religious history and legend.

The Agasthiar Publications in Tiruchi, for instance, has been one such publishing-house which has been bringing out a book on “mahamagam”.

Running to 50 pages, it carries the religious significance of the temples, particularly Sri Adhi Kumbeswarar and the Navakannigai associated with Sri Kasi Viswanathaswamy temple.

The first copy of the book was released by Sri Jeyendra Saraswathi Swamigal at Sri Mutt in Kumbakonam recently and was received by S. Balasubramanian, Chairman of City Union Bank and N. Kamakodi, its Managing Director.
title: Book on ‘mahamaham’ released
